page.title: 14TREES OF THE AREA
page.content: {Spiney restharrow}is so named because it rested the harrow at one time. {Ash}is a very tall tree. It flowers before the leaves appear. {Beech}is very tall. The fruit is mast. It is planted as a hedge sometimes. {Elder}belongs to Honey-suckle family. The berries are made into wine. {Horse Chestnut}has a fine display of 'candles' of white blossom. {Lime}is infested with aphids secreting honey dew on leaves. {Oak is quite common round the site of Habbie Ker's Hanging tree. {Sycamore}is plentiful in the deciduous plantations. {All these are common:}Elm, Chestnut, Sycamore are predominent around Clarilaw. {The Scots Pine}is found in most coniferous plantations in the area. {Yew,}an ancient symbol of life.
